1.content:
The inside of the warehouse was one of the most crowded and sweltering places you'd ever been in. There were dozens and dozens of people, all vying to push past each other and see what was going on. It didn't help that parts of the place were literally curtained off-- you assumed that was what the ad had meant by 'privacy ensured'.

It was a diverse group of people, too-- all sizes shapes and colors. There was an 80-year old black woman standing next to a 12-year old Asian boy. You guess money crossed all boundaries. It was certainly why you were here.

"This is cool!" Marcie exclaimed, her ginger hair swinging back and forth across her shoulders. She'd always been the more excitable one of the two of you. As far as you were concerned, this was just a quick paycheck. And maybe you were kind of curious to find out what this whole deal was about. But only kind of.

"Let's just get this over with. I want that money in my pocket ASAP!" you answered. You practically had to shout over the sound of the crowd. But they all fell silent when he stepped out.

He was a finely dressed man with an incredibly neat haircut. Clearly, this guy was from money. You took an immediate dislike to him. He was escorted by a thin, black-haired woman clutching a bundle of folders to the hastily-erected stage at the center of the room. It took a while, and he clearly wasn't the happiest with the situation.

Finally, he took the stage. Producing a microphone from within his coat, he began to speak.

"Hello everyone! My name is Theodore Blue. I bet you're all wondering why you're here today?"

There was a murmur of agreement within the crowd that you quickly joined in on.

"Well, allow me to introduce Doctor Emma Strauss!" He indicated the curtain he'd entered from with a wide sweep of his arm. A wild-looking blonde woman stormed up to stage quickly, her lab-coat trailing behind her. She didn't look all that put together, and the crowd parted for her almost instantly. This only made Theodore's face even more sour.

Doctor Strauss didn't looked thrilled, on the other hand. She grinned in a way that indicated she wasn't very used to it. Theodore handed her the mic.

"Yes, hello! I am the doctor! I'm very glad to see you all here today! I've been working on the things in the back for a very, very long time! They are my masterworks. Truly things of beauty." At a look from Theodore, she coughed. "Ahem. So, you will be participating in the very first human trials of some of my finest inventions. In a few minutes, we will start taking people back. Please do not attempt to run. That would be very...unkind."

There was something off about the way she spoke, but you pushed it aside. The nervous-looking woman from earlier took the mic from the doctor and smiled wanly. The doctor, on the other hand, slipped back behind the curtain. "Y-yes. My name is Violet-- I will be handing your assignment sheets out to you all-- oh, no, don't worry, it's not work-- we just need to see what everyone is interested in! If you're interested in more than one, wait until your first test is complete to check your second box-- please!"

Theodore snatched the mic from her before she could go any further. Violet hurried down the stairs and began handing out sheets to the first round of people. Poor girl was sweating even harder than you, and you hadn't even thought that possible.

"Thank you, Violet. Now, you have to engage in three experiments to be eligible for the full 10k. If you don't, you get a third of the money."

The crowd groaned.

"Remember though, in the interest of time, you are only allowed to engage in three different experiments! After you do, your time is up and you will be asked to leave the tent. Thank you for your time. Make sure ours is worth it," he finished somewhat menacingly.

You were starting to get second thoughts about this whole thing. Human experimentation was illegal or something, wasn't it? But maybe the rules were different if you volunteered. You were just curious to find out what these machines were that had Doctor Strauss so excited.

Marcie latched onto your wrist and dragged you over to where Violet was.

"Come on! Let's get a hop on this! We don't wanna spoil the surprise for ourselves with a wait!"

You just shook your head and went along with it. Marcie reached over a middle-aged woman's shoulder to grab two sheets from Violet. Almost absentmindedly, she handed one to you, and the both of you began to read.

You raised your eyebrows.

Mindswap Contraption?

DNA Infuser?

Object Transmogrifier?

Timeline Manipulator?

And there were a lot more, even stranger ones that you had no desire to read at the moment. You had no idea what any of these meant, but they all sounded weird. Did you still even want to do this? But you had a pencil in your hands and ten thousand dollars in your heart, so...

Yeah, probably.

What do you check off first?
1.title: A Warehouse and A Checklist

11.content:
You decide to check off the craziest sounding one. Mindswap? Like a bodyswap? Surely that wasn't possible? Then again, they were paying you the big bucks for this, so maybe...nah.

You ask Marcie what she checked off. She grins.

"Timeline Manipulator! Doesn't that just sound groovy?"

It sure does, but probably not in the way she's thinking.

Pretty soon, Violet collects all the sheets. It's a while before she calls out your name, but it does happen eventually. Marcie squeezes your hand as you get up to disappear beyond the curtains.

"Good luck," she says.

"Always," you smirk. She smirks back and hits you on the shoulder playfully. Before you know it, Violet has taken you beyond the curtain, where you pass by several more until you reach the end of the hall. She parts the cloth to let you through, where you see Doctor Strauss hard at work on what looks like two human-sized metal pods linked by a single tube at their tops.You guess that's the Mindswap Contraption.

She grins at the sight of you and indicates the left pod quite eagerly. "Go," she says, "climb on in! Since you got here first, you get the privilege of choosing your partner! Don't worry, the other ones will get their own turns."

You opened your mouth to ask something but were cut off by the doctor's sudden change of expression.

"No questions! Into the pod!"

You shrugged and went ahead and laid down in the pod, back-first. The pod's open hatch swung down and sealed you in with a click. Somewhat worried, you pushed against the heavy metal lid. It didn't budge.

"Hey...."

The doctor glanced over her shoulder and winked at him. "It's perfectly fine, I assure you. That is exactly what is supposed to happen."

Well, okay. You were just glad you weren't afraid of enclosed spaces.

Doctor Strauss read something off a monitor on a table hooked up to the machine. She turned to face the curtain expectantly. So did you, for that matter.

Five women walked through the door. Five very different women. You were beginning to get seriously worried. If this machine worked, you didn't particularly want to end up at the opposite gender-- or in anyone else's body at all. This was a seriously ill-advised idea.

Doctor Strauss stepped in front of the women and grinned at you.

"So, allow me to introduce your options!"

The first woman was a middle-aged mom type. She'd clearly let herself go recently-- her pink t-shirt was struggling to contain her flab, and her pants were so tight you could practically see everything. Curly ginger hair was draped over her shoulders.

"Melissa Abernathy! 42 years old and mother of three! Ooh, I bet she'd like a change of pace!"

The second woman was much shorter. And skinnier. Oh god-- she looked so weak. She might have been fourteen years old? Certainly not much older than sixteen. Her black hair was greasy and her retainer was obvious. Thinking about being her was making your head spin.

"Ursula Ruiz! She's only fifteen, but she's a senior in highschool. Bet you'd like being a genius like her!"

The third woman was definitely your type-- if you ever had the balls to ask anyone out. She was about your age and curvy in all the right places. She was wearing a pair of tight tight jean shorts-- the top of her thong was peeking out. Her top wasn't much better.

"Eunhee Kang, 27 years old! She's a hard worker. An admirable trait!"

The fourth woman was-- oh god, she was pregnant! How was that gonna work? But you had to admit, it piqued your curiosity.

"Sunshine Jones, 31! What an appropriate name-- isn't she just glowing?"

The last woman had something in her ears-- just barely visible beyond her long brown hair. Your eyes widened as you realized what they were-- hearing aids! She was hard of hearing?

"Katya LeGuin, 19! What a beautiful girl. She lost her hearing in an accident. It sure would be nice for her to get a chance to experience something else!"

Was she trying to guilt trip you? Well, it wasn't totally ineffective... None of these choices seemed good-- You wanted out! You slammed your hand against the hatch.

"HEY! LET ME OUT!"

Doctor Strauss shook her head, an evil grin on her face. "I can't! Nor do I want to. Now choose. Which of these fine women's bodies will you choose to live in?"

You wanted to scream in frustration. Your heart thudded in your chest as you examined your choices. This was bad--- really bad. What were you supposed to do?

Who were you supposed to choose?

info.brief_description: One day, you answer a mysterious newspaper ad and end up as part of an experiment!
info.description:
Down on your luck and without any money to your name, you answer a mysterious newspaper ad asking for volunteers to show up at a nearby abandoned warehouse, with a payout of $10,000. It sounds shady, but you figure-- what's the worst that could happen?

You'll soon find out.

Characters:

YOU- A 28 year old caucasian man with little ambition and even fewer prospects.

DEREK SMITH- Your marginally more successful 26 year old cousin who's letting you stay at his house while you try to get back on your feet. Pretty much the only member of your family that you're in contact with.

MARCIE SUMMERS- Your best friend, somehow. The two of you met in college and bonded over your mutual love of cannabis and attractive women. The one who drove you to the abandoned warehouse-- mostly because she owns a car and you don't.

DOCTOR EMMMA STRAUSS- The brains behind this mysterious experiment. She's invented a whole host of devices and can't wait to try them out with some victi-- ahem, volunteers. She's got an ego, so be careful not to talk too derisively about her babies-- the machines she's worked wonders with.

THEODORE BLUE- An incredibly charismatic business man who is responsible for funding the experiment. He also doesn't really care about what happens to the volunteers, so don't count on him to keep you safe.

VIOLET CHANG- The woman in charge of keeping track of all the paperwork and making sure all the proper boxes get checked. She may be stressed and overworked, but she genuinely cares about people.
